abstract.text: An instance you use to capture Metal command data in your app.

inlineContent.text: Capture manager works with Metal’s frame capture feature to:
Capture data about Metal commands programmatically. See
Filter captured commands to a specific
Assign a capture scope to use as the default when you click the camera button to invoke a frame capture from Xcode’s debug bar. See
The Metal debugger requires you to enable GPU Frame Capture in your project settings; see
The capture manager records commands within
objects that you create and commit while the capture session is active.
For more information about Metal frame capture, see

abstract.text: Analyze your app’s performance by configuring your project to use the Metal debugger.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Capturing a Metal workload in Xcode

abstract.text: Analyze your app’s performance by invoking Metal’s frame capture.
Debug and profile your Metal workload with a GPU trace.
Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
A configuration for a Metal capture session.
The kinds of destinations for captured command data.
An instance you use to capture Metal command data in your app.
The capture scope to use when a capture is initiated in Xcode.
A Boolean value that indicates whether Metal commands are being captured.
Creates a capture scope for commands submitted to a specific command queue.
Creates a capture scope for commands submitted to a specific device object.
Provides the shared capture manager for your Metal app.
Starts capturing any of your app’s Metal commands that are executed by the command queue.
Starts capturing any of your app’s Metal commands that are executed by the device object.
Starts capturing any of your app’s Metal commands that are in the specified capture scope.
Starts capturing any of your app’s Metal commands, with the capture session defined by a descriptor object.
Stops capturing Metal commands.
Checks to see whether a particular capture destination is supported.
A protocol that defines custom boundaries for a GPU frame capture.
A container that stores a sequence of GPU commands that you encode into it.
The main Metal interface to a GPU that apps use to draw graphics and run computations in parallel.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.

topicSections.title: Querying Support for a Capture Destination

abstract.text: Start capturing Metal commands for presentation in the Metal debugger.
